intro: Buchnera elongata f. pilosior, commonly known as the hairy elongated buchnera, is a variant of the species characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically features elongated, narrow leaves with a dense covering of fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its morphological variation and potential ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
